usefulItems: baking sheet, parchment paper, pie pan or shallow dish
title: Hawaiian Summer Rolls

ingredients.content: 16 oz fresh raw medium shrimp, peeled, deveined
8 oz red cabbage, halved (approx. ¼ head)
1 mango, sliced lengthwise in pieces (⅛ in.)
1 avocado (med.), sliced lengthwise in pieces (⅛ in.)
4 green onions white and green parts, cut in pieces (2 in.), sliced lengthwise

preparations.content: Place water into mixing bowl and heat <b>10 min/212°F/speed 1<b>. Transfer to a bowl, add cellophane noodles and set aside to steep fo 15 minutes.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add rice wine vinegar, sambal oelek, sugar, soy sauce, cayenne and cornstarch and mix <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>, then cook <b>15 min/212°F/speed 2<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place water into mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish into position and weigh in shrimp. Season with salt and pepper, evenly distribute seasoned shrimp between Varoma dish and tray, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>12-14 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>, until shrimp are cooked through. Remove Varoma, transfer shrimp to a plate and set aside to cool. Butterfly each shrimp by slicing the body almost in half lengthwise, stopping just before cutting all the way through.
Place cabbage into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Drain reserved cellophane noodles through simmering basket over a pie pan or shallow dish and transfer noodles to a seperate bowl. Reserve water for dipping rice paper wrappers.

hintsAndTricks: Be careful not to overfill your spring roll wrapper because this will cause the rice paper to tear.
